comments.body: This test doesn't prove `--all` is wired properly, it'll pass with and without your change.

This test proves that the wait command is able to await multiple resources, which is what the use-case that `--all` expands to. Neither of these tests are checking for flag-parsing as this is not made in the wait package but is a part of `genericclioptions`. Flag parsing should thus not be tested here as it is covered under `k8s.io/cli-runtime/pkg/genericclioptions`. This test should be here, as there was no previous test ensuring that `wait` was able to handle multiple resources. Which is relevant when this change is introduced.

I'm not saying this test is wrong, I'm just saying it doesn't ensure `--all` is wired well. I'm also aware we're missing flag wiring PRs, so either add one here or add one to test-cmd suite. We need to ensure something that will ensure that `--all` works as expected.
As discussed on Slack, we will add test for `kubectl wait` in `test-cmd` to test for proper flag parsing. I will amend the commit with these changes :)
